cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) SSW of Caibarien, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest overnight, then turning northwest on Saturday and continuing toward the Florida Keys and the eastern Gulf of Mexico, with landfall expected along the Florida Panhandle before moving inland across Alabama and the Tennessee Valley.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Englewood FL south and east to Ocean Reef FL (south-west Florida coast).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for the Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, west coast of Florida, and Florida Panhandle; inland impacts expected across AL, GA, TN after landfall.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (locally 3-6 inches forecast across parts of GA)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<6%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible late Sunday–Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain capable of 2-4 inches with isolated higher totals Monday; risk of localized flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls and isolated thunderstorms Monday could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements.
